com.example.healthtracker

Class UserDataController<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.healthtracker.UserDataController<E>

  • public class UserDataController<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to load data from server or local cache as well as save to server and local cache. Server is saved to and loaded from using elastic search. Objects are serialized and saved to shared preferences for local cache. The methods for serializing Objects and reading and writing serialized objects to shared preferences are taken from the Student Picker for Android video series by Abram Hindle. Student Picker for Android by Abram Hindle: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5PPD0ncJU1g
    Since:
    2018/11/2

        public static CareProvider loadCareProviderData(android.content.Context context)

        Parameters:
        context - input context to use to access shared preferences
        Returns:
        returns CareProvider object corresponding to the currently logged in CareProvider

        Returns:

      • loadPatientById

        public static Patient loadPatientById(android.content.Context context,
                                      java.lang.String ID)
        Retrieves a specific patient by inputting their id
        Parameters:
        context - input context to use to access shared preferences
        ID - input the ID of the patient to be returned
        Returns:
        Patient to who the ID input belongs to

      • savePatientData

        public static void savePatientData(android.content.Context context,
                                   Patient patient)
        Saves patient object to server if internet is available and the server is reachable. Always saves patient object locally. Creates toast message to confirm success or failure of saving patient to server.
        Parameters:
        context - input context needed to access Shared Preferences
        patient - input patient to save

      • saveCareProviderData

        public static void saveCareProviderData(android.content.Context context,
                                        CareProvider careProvider)
        Saves CareProvider object to server if internet is available and the server is reachable. Always saves CareProvider object locally. Creates toast message to confirm success or failure of saving CareProvider to server.
        Parameters:
        context - input context needed to access Shared Preferences
        careProvider - input CareProvider to save

      • syncPatientData

        public static void syncPatientData(android.content.Context context)
        Replaces server data of current logged in patient with local cache if an internet connection is found. Otherwise simply creates a toast message indicating failure to sync.
        Parameters:
        context - input context to use to access Shared Preferences

      • syncCareProviderData

        public static void syncCareProviderData(android.content.Context context)
        Replaces server data of current logged in CareProvider with local cache if an internet connection is found. Otherwise simply creates a toast message indicating failure to sync.
        Parameters:
        context - input context to use to access Shared Preferences

      • serializeRecord

        public static java.lang.String serializeRecord(android.content.Context context,
                                               PatientRecord record)
        Serialize record into a string and return that string.
        Parameters:
        context - input context to initialize a new UserDataController
        record - input record to create a serialized string of
        Returns:
        serialized string of record

      • unSerializeRecord

        public static PatientRecord unSerializeRecord(android.content.Context context,
                                              java.lang.String recordString)
        Convert serialized record string back into a PatientRecord object
        Parameters:
        context - input context to initialize a new UserDataController
        recordString - input serialized string of record to convert back into a PatientRecord object
        Returns:
